value:
Usage:
  chaplain                                    - run all tests
  chaplain run <suite:test> <suite:test>...   - only run the tests given
  chaplain bless <suite:test> <suite:test>... - bless the results of these tests as correct

Test patterns: 
  <suite:test> can be literal, e.g. 'my-suite:my-test', or a regexp, for example
  something like 'my-suite:.*' will match all tests from that suite.

Options:
  -d, --storage-dir <dir> - where to store blessed output, defaults to .chaplain
  -f, --file <testfile>   - where to get your testfile, default chaplain.tests.js
  -i, --interactive
  -I, --non-interactive   - interactive mode allows you to bless changes directly
                            from the test run. Non-interactive is better for use
                            in scripts and CI environments. Default mode depends
                            on whether Chaplain is run from an interactive TTY.
  -c, --color
  -C, --no-color          - forces ANSI color output to be enabled/disabled.
  -h, --help              - display this help text
